H0.text: Live birth is the reproductive result that viviparous refers to in most mammals.

H1.text: Identical twins are the reproductive result that viviparous, a condition that most mammals possess, refers to.

H2.text: Spawning is the reproductive result that most mammals are viviparous, which refers to.

H3.text: Laying eggs is the reproductive result that viviparous refers to in most mammals.

A4.text: Viviparity is the development of the embryo inside the body of the mother until the mother gives birth to a fully or partially developed juvenile that is at least metabolically independent.

A5.text: Viviparity is opposed to oviparity, where the embryos develop independently outside the mother in eggs until they are developed enough to break out as hatchlings; and ovoviviparity, where the embryos are developed in eggs that remain carried inside the mother's body until the hatchlings emerge from the mother as juveniles, similar to a live birth.
